intro: Galium hispidum, commonly known as rough bedstraw, is a flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant features slender, hairy stems and small, opposite leaves with a rough texture. Its flowers are white or pale pink, clustered in umbels, and bloom in early summer. Galium hispidum produces small, three-lobed berries that are dispersed by birds and other animals.
